job_title: Financial Aid Advisor in San Antonio, TX
pros: Treats their people like human beings. They fully support and stand behind you. The first time in 10 years I’ve been able to say I love my job.
cons: None that I know of as of now.

review_title: Company Does Not Care about their Employees
pros: - remote base work - various opportunities for overtimes
cons: - toxic work culture - company makes/requires you to work on federal holidays; ex: were told we must work MLK day when offices are to be closed - low pay - no set PTO as stated when you get hired, you accumulate PTO based on the amount of hours you work - toxic work culture, employees discriminate and harass other employees and leadership continues to not do anything about it. - frequent turnover in all departments

job_title: Campus President in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Amazing people to work with and very rewarding supporting students pursuing their careers in the allied health care fields.
cons: The campus and organization is growing so we are working through some processes that need to be scaled to accommodate our size. Good problems to have!

pros: School has great academic value
cons: BOD is no Intune with the middle management

job_title: Student Success Advisor in Fort Worth, TX
pros: I am impressed with the culture of this school. The staff, students and leadership make this an enjoyable place to work.

review_title: Student Based Success and Opportunities for Growth
job_title: Assistant Director of Education in Austin, TX
pros: I have been at CHCP for 5 years and in that time, have seen the changes this company provides for individuals to change their lives by entering the medical field. Their student centered approach promotes everything that is done at all campuses. Compliance and understanding the "why" behind everything is priority. They also provide many opportunities for growth - I have received 2 promotions since starting here and they continue to invest in my development as a leader and an educator.
cons: No cons at this time.

pros: Multie campuses in Texas Opportunity for growth Student centric
cons: Frequent turnover Unclear or last minute communications Lower pay rates than comparable institutions

pros: Teaching students to have a career they may never have been able to have, they are the only reason I stay.
cons: Pay is ridiculous especially when students are at times making almost what we do right out of school when most teachers have 30 plus years in this field. They don't keep promises and it;s always an excuse why we can't get a raise. I don't recommended you work here unless you can afford a low paying job.

pros: Great work environment with great people to work with.
cons: I don’t think I have any contacts because I love my job

review_title: I-CARE Values are Real at CHCP
pros: The leadership including the Chancellor and the C- Suite through each campus reflects a strong commitment to integrity and excellence in all that is done at the corporate offices as well as the local campus.
cons: I have not found any to report. Great company and great people.

job_title: Program Director in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Flexibility, work environment, colleagues, office space
cons: Poor direction, time off, communication, no collaborative effort

pros: Not many pros to be honest
cons: There were plenty. Leadership was discriminatory and went out of their way to exclude people.

pros: The people that work there.
cons: I knew this place was toxic whenever there was a big freeze in Feb 2021 and they were urging us to drive on ice to work from the main office because our homes had no power. They also awarded people who risked their lives to drive in the freeze while not paying employees that were unable to clock in and work due to power outages in homes. They also told us we had to use PTO to make up for those missed hours. Mind you, we accumulated about 4 hours per pay period. So one full shift PTO took one month to obtain. Also, they give $1-$2 raises after one year. Its laughable.

review_title: Okay Place to Work At If You Are In The Right Position
pros: The pay was good and I loved the students
cons: Find out first hand what the position duties are from corporate, because people at the campus level will take advantage of you.

review_title: Not a place for true professionals to work
pros: Seeing the students happy and engaged.
cons: Don’t try to work here if you are a seasoned professional. Once you start to show your worth, your superiors will do all they can to make you feel small. They’re not in it for the students or the employees, only for themselves. HR is not approachable so you have no one to turn to when your superiors exhibit bad behavior. Employee turnover is high for a reason. Salaried employees are expected to work 50 hour weeks with no additional compensation and bad behavior is constantly rewarded because it’s all a game of politics.

job_title: Diagnostic Medical Sonography Instructor in Houston, TX
pros: Team spirit and community like atmosphere
cons: For profit and deadlines to meet

job_title: Clinical coordinator, surgical technology instructor in San Antonio, TX

cons: None, really happy here. A little stressful at times but, where isn’t there stress.

job_title: Financial Aid Advisor in Houston, TX
pros:
Coworkers and immediate managers were great
They were good at feeding us
The office environment was nice
cons:
The DFA  for online has caused low morale and created a hostile work environment. The work atmosphere was very unpleasant due to being disrespected, demeaned, and always being threatened with job security. Not a pleasant department to work in. The immediate managers were  cool; his presence made you not want to come to work because you got treated like nothing.
No one wants to work with/for someone that doesn't respect you as a person as well as an employee.

review_title: Fast becoming the place to work in career ed!

pros: CHCP's value system is like no other proprietary college system in the country. It's just not lip service! It starts at the top with the CEO who is a phenomenal, personable leader laser focused on fostering a caring environment for both employees and students. This company is one of the good guys.
cons: Processes are being refined daily to keep pace with the system's growth. Not a bad thing, but be prepared to work and give your input.

pros: Great team, amazing boss, fun work

pros: Nice school, Learning environment, Helping students

job_title: Senior Admissions Advisor in Fort Worth, TX
pros: It is a great team environment. All departments work great together to try to do the best for the students. This team genuinely cares abut changing lives and helping each other. The upper management is helpful and cares about their employees! It is a great place to work!
cons: Everyone is Awesome! I don’t see any Con’s at all.

pros: Occasionally there will be lunch or donuts for those on campus.
cons: Much demand placed on staff...students are your boss and they know it!! Management does not support the staff as they are scared of the students.

job_title: Admission Advisor in Fort Worth, TX
pros: They care about you and their students. They want see you succeed , changing lives for the best.
cons: No cons honestly an honorable company.

review_title: Love the challenge of changing lives!
job_title: Senior Director of Career Services in Austin, TX
pros:
The opportunity to be a part of the ripple effect of changing lives, while feeling valued in my own passion and hard work ethic is something that has rarely been replicated by other positions I've held. I can't think of a more rewarding career than helping others obtain their own career success while connecting with our community as well as the growing  healthcare industry here in Austin. 

Management offers support and mentorship and seems to uphold the same overall goal of supporting underserved populations achieve their goals of becoming successful health care professionals. 

I appreciate the support and guidance of my direct supervisor as well as that from our corporate level. And I'm fortunate enough to supervise a great team that truly cares about our students through the entire student life cycle from their very first campus tour, to graduation and through to successful employment in their chosen field of study. They really believe in helping our students begin "the career of their lives". 

So from coworker admiration, to management support down to my daily duties and career growth, I feel fulfilled in my professional journey thus far with the opportunities CHCP has afforded me.
cons: Not necessarily a con, but to be successful when working to help our demographic, you must thrive on being challenged,  while being flexible, adaptable, supportive and a consistent positive team player. There is no such thing as "down time" when you're helping to change lives!

review_title: I had a good time and worked with good people. Enjoyed my time there.
pros: Training people to become future healthcare employees.
cons: The company seemed disorganized at times from an instructor's perspective, however to the company's credit, they are growing and these kind of issues will happen during growth. I also feel I could have been a better asset to the company if given the opportunity.

job_title: Senior Admissions Advisor in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Helping the students change their lives
cons: Demand from management to make numbers

pros: Good people and great mission. It is great to see students graduating.
cons: Almost no room to advance.

job_title: Career Services Advisor in Austin, TX
pros:
Focus on student success
Team environment
Staff appreciation
Staff recognition
Community partnerships
I am fairly new to CHCP but my experience working here thus  far has been amazing. My team in Career Services has been supportive since day one and I really feel I can really count on them to learn all I need to know to help students gain meaningful employment. All of the staff is friendly and helpful when needed and really make a point to make me feel welcomed and a part of the team. I am also very impressed with how hard the admissions team works to assist students and ensure that they are successful and feel supported. This is one of the best working environment I have been in. Even when things get busy you can always find a helping hand, it is clear that we all have the same goal and want to help each other no matter the department achieve said goal. I would be remiss not to mention how lucky I feel to have such a wonderful Director  in Career Services, she is top notch.
cons: I have been with CHCP since October and I couldn’t be happier to be a part of this thriving team. No cons

review_title: Refreshing experience so far in an outcomes, compliance focused organization.
pros: You get to be a part of an organization that is mission driven and accomplishing those outcomes.  There is lots of autonomy with a thin corporate leadership level and campus leadership is empowered to manage their schools.  We Re able to provide real support services tailored to the local populations we serve.
cons: The industry is demanding and those without true passion for what we do often have a difficult time adapting.  Decentralized operations are good but do add a layer of complexity in the operating model.  You must be able to multi task and pivot quickly to be successful.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Worth, TX
pros: It's close to the interstate
cons: Management is a joke and never enough time!

review_title: The College of Health Care Professions
pros:
My name is Kathie Kohout and I have been employed by The College of Health Care Professions since August 2015.

I have found my position here to be very rewarding on many levels.  As an educator, I get the satisfaction of interacting with students to help them achieve their dreams. This is my main motivator: however, my particular campus (Austin), has become like extended family to me.  My colleagues offer support and encouragement on a daily  basis.  My superiors are always willing  to help and assist with establishing best practices.  We have an online component through our company that offers many training and educational resources to become a more effective educator and person in general.

The education industry is one of consistent change. I find my company to embrace those changes to adapt to student engagement. This creates an environment that is never static, always growing to become the high standard of post-secondary learning.
cons: In the length of time that I have been with The College of Health Care Professions I can not comment on any cons.  An enjoyable place to work

job_title: Externship Coordinator in Fort Worth, TX
pros: The College of Health Care Professions is dedicated to providing the very best education to our students. The Core Values, ICARE,  are definitely demonstrated by each member of the CHCP Team.  Starting with Admissions’ responsibility of making sure that the students are well informed regarding their career choices. Financial Aid who goes what some others may consider “above and beyond” to help students understand what’s available to them financially, is actually the norm for our FA Team.  Then there’s the Education Department.  The instructors bring compassion,  drive,  a spirit of excellence, mutual respect for one another and a wealth of experience to make sure the students are well-prepared to enter into the medical field. The Career Services  Team is always available  to the students during their time on campus and after graduation to assist them as they make their transition from college life to the “real world of  work”. With all of these components in place, CHCP really helps students “change their lives.” Taking them from their dreams to reality.
cons: None to report at this time.

pros: The culture at CHCP is absolutely amazing, everyone is always in a great mood and it reflects in the Colleges numbers and student satisfaction. If you check Google reviews you can see that students have nothing but positive things to say about our College. As an employee I feel appreciated, I gladly work hard and put forth the extra effort simply because I love the fact that I am changing lives on a daily basis. All of the employees here in McAllen work so hard, they are so dedicated to providing the best educational experience to our students, and I can't help but drive to work with a smile on my face. The other best part of working here is that it is a growing college, so there is opportunity for growth within the organization. The pay and benefits are great as well.
cons: If you don't have a passion for helping others, and if you don't want to put in a little overtime when needed then this is not the right career for you.

review_title: Love this place! Finally a school in it for the student!
pros: School believes in putting the student first. Fast paced work environment. Attending graduation is very rewarding. Students get training and hired and watching their life change from the first day to being given a job offer is AMAZING! Great team culture across departments supportive of the students. Work environment is fun and your ideas are listened to. The leadership is really responsive to suggestions and support the staff.
cons: If fast paced isn't for you, this is not your place. The expected service time for the students is immediate and there are a lot of students to service. They also hold people accountable for poor work habits and not upholding the Core Values. If you are not able to get to work on time or lack integrity you will not be there long.

review_title: A great place with incredible people!
pros: There are a lot of pros when it comes to CHCP, the dedication to the students is always first, and because of that dedication, there's a strict adherence to accreditation guidelines and standards. What's more important is the quality of the people; from the administration, to admissions, to financial aid, to faculty, and everyone in between, the people here care not just about what they do, but who they're doing it for. We see our 'jobs' as true callings, an intrinsic need to give something to not only the community in the form of comprehensively educated and competent graduates, but in providing exceptional service to those graduates who will carry their own legacies forward. Our motto is, "We Care" and each and every one of us takes that motto to heart! CHCP understands that the future of health care is literally in our hands, and that it's an honor.
cons: None really,  the administrations' 'open door' policy makes it easy to ask about anything.

job_title: Senior Financial Aid Advisor in Houston, TX
pros: I love working here. My co-workers are great and everyone is so friendly and always willing to help you.The Management team is truly open door and make you feel comfortable going to any of them if you have an issue. I like how the departments work well together and offer assistance when needed. Great TEAMWORK! The benefits are really good and the compensation, definitely no complaints. The hours are a good balance for me with work and home life.
cons: Feed us too much! I cant really say I have any cons from my personal experience. I haven't had any issues since I have been here. The company is very informative on things that are going on, such as COVID-19 and keeping employees safe.

pros: The College of Health Care Professions truly cares.  Under the direction of our new Campus President, so many great things have transpired.  I have been with the company for close to 2 years and within these past 8 months, I have seen so much  growth throughout the organization.  There are so many more opportunities that Dr. Lakhlani has on the table that he stays transparent about.  Have prior teaching experience, this is one of the educational facilities that I have the honor of saying I am part of the team.  Team ICare!!
cons: We are becoming a better organization and with this improvement, there are growing pains that we will encounter.  Not a con...GROWTH.

review_title: I love working here and the way how we help our students to change their lives.
pros: My experience at CHCP has been great. I’ve been with company 3 years now and there’s really not much to complain about. I’ve been promoted and watched many other colleagues be promoted as well. The culture is amazing. They’re rewarding us with something every single week. The online (Digital Services) department is truly a great place to work. It is also a very diverse environment. The leadership team does their best to encourage growth and has been promoting like crazy. I haven’t experienced any problems taking time off. I was actually encouraged to use PTO to take vacation and stay refreshed during this COVID-19 pandemic. This company is totally student centric as well. It is the only school I’ve worked for who truly goes above and beyond to ensure students are successful.
cons: Those free donuts make us round :)

job_title: Assistant Director of Admissions in San Antonio, TX
pros: I value working  for a company that I believe puts their students first.  I have been very impressed by the clear communication from our corporate office down.  It has been exciting to work with individuals daily that I feel I learn from and am challenged by.  I wake up motivated to come to work with such great people.  There is a clear mission and team approach to providing quality education to our students.  The San Antonio team works together to serve our students with integrity.  I have also noticed that this company is very open to innovation and that is exciting for both the employees and students we serve.  The company is also very involved in the community and is always looking for ways to give back.   Working for CHCP has been a great decision!
cons: No cons to report from my experience.

job_title: Master Admissions Advisor in McAllen, TX
pros:
I love working at CHCP. CHCP has given me the opportunity to help make a better RGV. I have worked for CHCP for almost 3 yrs and every day I am excited to go to work. I work alongside passionate and hard working employees, who strive to be excellent. People who care to help others. 
At CHCP we work as a team. Together we help each other innovate and adapt to change. We hold each other accountable so that we can provide quality service. We respect each other, our students, our community and employers, by listening and encouraging communication. 
Our Leaders communicate effectively by engaging with us, acknowledging our accomplishments, and promoting within. They lead by example by working hard providing  feedback and accepting recommendations.
cons: I have not come across any cons, at CHCP everyone is held accountable and together we are constantly working towards improvement and excellence.

pros:
As an instructor at this college for over 16 years, I have experienced many improvements - especially in the last four years.  These needed improvements were possible because of our leadership and this institutions deep and abiding commitment to it's students, employees, and community.

From the cooperate level to our local campus, I see this caring commitment demonstrated in everyday professional behavior by our staff and instructors.

I teach the Gen.Ed. Prerequisites classes and many students begin their careers with me.  I see these anxious wide-eyed students on their first day and I see the confident and proud professionals on their last day at graduation.

The ability to share this exciting journey with them and to have the resources and support needed to enhance their learning experience are just some of the reasons why I teach and continue to grow with CHCP.
cons: None to report at this time

pros:
Students. We are here for our students, first and foremost. 
Rewarding career.  Every day, we are improving the lives of our students and their families.
This is a very supportive environment for faculty, staff and students.  The campus works together and we are a close family.
There is room for advancement and promoting from within is encouraged
Upper management is very receptive to ideas and willing to try something new
cons: It is difficult to lose a student due to outside forces we are unable to control.  As much as we problem solve and try to help our students, it is not always possible.

review_title: CHCP is an awesome place to work!
pros: Before I was hired with CHCP, I looked up the company, it was on top of my list of places to work.  I worked at two different schools before  but never one that was in the medical field. I'm now employed at CHCP Southwest  Frwy and Fondren, it was the best decision I ever made. My colleagues are professional and fun to work with and knowing thst there's room for advancement was a big plus.  Our main goal at CHCP is assisting  students with their educational dream and watching it come true.
cons: I can truely say there are no cons working here.

job_title: Senior IT Technician in San Antonio, TX
pros: From the moment I walked I started they made me feel welcomed and part of a great family. My manager doesn't micro manage and is always there for me if I need anything or bounce an idea of off. They trust me in getting the job done. If I need anything to do my job my manager always makes sure I get what I need to complete my job. The environment is awesome and friendly. It's nice to once in a while chat about our lives and joke with each other.  I travel to the Austin campus twice a week and they compensate me for the mileage. Perks are awesome as well.
cons: Nothing bad to say. All positive feedback back

pros: Each day brings new challenges and problems to solve, but it also brings great reward. There is nothing like knowing you've had a hand in helping someone change their life and as one of our recent graduates stated, when a life is changed "it changes generations to come beyond my time". I certainly have a job with purpose that I can be proud of. I look forward to continued career growth with CHCP.
cons: We have seen many changes over the last 12 months and hope that growth and improvement remain our focus.

job_title: Project Manager in San Antonio, TX
pros: Loved watching the "light bulbs" coming on in students' heads.   After 9 months of asking for equipment to have students educated properly before going out in the field, approval was finally given and badly used equipment showed up on campus.
cons:
Management doesn't praise those employees that do ALL the work!!  
Severe turnaround and students want to be spoon fed and expect to be ready to pass National Registry Exams.

pros: CHCP is literally the best place to work in Houston. I don't say this as a punch line or a cliché. The professionalism and family oriented culture of the office breeds well rounded skillful employees. The leadership here definitely surpassed my expectations and I can't wait to see where this innovative company will take me. Dr. Lakhani has been a great addition to the CHCP family! He is a great leader and is moving full steam ahead with fantastic ideas and ambition.
cons: I honestly cannot name any cons to working at CHCP.

review_title: The College of Health Care Professions
pros: Management is willing to listen to new ideas, embrace what is working and will change what isn't working.  I believe the new upper management is headed in the right direction.  It will take time to correct and move forward in a positive direction.
cons: Salaried employees have a big workload with very tight deadlines.  All companies face the same challenges, however work and home life really needs to be balanced.

review_title: Professional and rewarding place to work with opportunities for advancement.
job_title: Placement Coordinator in San Antonio, TX
pros: My co-workers are very knowledgeable and we work as a team with productive results. Management presents special goals and keeps an open mind to our ideas.
cons: I wish the PTO (personal time off) was separate from sick days . If I am sick and I miss a day of work, it pretty much is deducted from my vacation days.

review_title: CHCP is a great working environment that offers a challenging and rewarding career of your life.
job_title: Director of Education in San Antonio, TX
pros: CHCP offers a great corporate structure that allows one the opportunity to flourish and realize career goals and dreams.  Support from higher management to local campus management helps develop an individual into the very best one can be.
cons: CHCP is still growing strong.  With the great leadership in place the stars are the limits.

review_title: Amazing Place to Work - CHCP Houston NW Campus
job_title: Campus Administration in North Houston, TX
pros: Since starting with the company I have never felt an organization that makes you feel more welcome and appreciated. The ICARE attitude really emanates at all levels. Faculty are compassionate about educating their students and work closely with a dedicated Staff to ensure students are successful. The Corporate support is more than amazing. They allow all campus leaders to flourish in their own right.
cons: Open up more campuses soon! We need to keep spreading our names across our communities to show the success our students are having in caring for others.

job_title: Senior Financial Aid Advisor in Austin, TX
pros: Working with CHCP has been a great joy and over the last two years I have seen continued growth for the company, student's, and employee success.  With a friendly and inviting atmosphere, I have had the opportunity to build strong relationships with co-workers and students.  We strive for the best customer service and all work hard to help each other change lives.  It truly has become like a family and personally rewarding as you see students move forward in their careers.
cons: No cons at this time.

job_title: Senior Financial Aid Advisor in Fort Worth, TX
pros: It is a privilege to work for this institution that believes on helping  students to succeed in life. Their goal is to change the student's dreams into reality by providing the tools they need in the future career. They follow the core values I CARE (Innovation, Compassion, Accountability, Respect and Excellence)with students and employees. Their compliance team is very professional. I enjoy coming every day to work to know they believe in what I believe.
cons: I would like for health insurance to be more affordable. Prices are way to high.

job_title: Assistant Director, Financial Aid in Houston, TX
pros: I have been working at CHCP in Financial Aid full-time almost 8 years. The environment is Friendly and profession. We have great teamwork and I have had a lot of fun working there. I love that we are here for our students to getting them the career of their life. CHCP has always been a company with the ability to grow with promotions, love how we promote within. I also love that CHCP cares about their employees.
cons: None that I can think of, I love working at CHCP

pros: The College of Health Care Professions has a great working environment. When it comes to working with students CHCP Online division continues to strives to make sure students are receiving the best online education possible. CHCP leadership continues to provide innovative ways to make the job fun and exciting. The cohesiveness between the Online team is what makes things work. With the current COVID 19 pandemic the Online team continues to go above and beyond to provide excellent service for our students all across Texas.
cons: No cons at this time

job_title: Director of Financial Aid in San Antonio, TX
pros: I've been working with CHCP for 3 years.  I love my job and the people that I work with.  Our mission of helping students is the common thread that motivates us all!  We have the best students and our outcomes and placement rates reflect the hard work of all of our students and faculty!  CHCP south opened in January, our campus is beautiful and includes the most up to date equipment.  I am very proud and thankful to work for CHCP!
cons: I really can't think of any!

review_title: The New College of Health Care Professions--I'm Loving it!
pros: Excellent top management who have experience and drive everyone to clear goals.  Good pay and good treatment.  Nice place to work.  Great deal of pride in what we do.
cons: No cons thus far.  There are always opportunities for improvement, but no real cons yet.

job_title: Financial Aid Advisor in San Antonio, TX
pros: CEO is friendly ,available and involved .
cons: Programs are not good . Students graduate from programs and never get licensed investing money without reward . LMRT program specifically . President and admissions director turnover is a joke . Admissions advisors are sales people overcharging students For a Medical assisting program . They keep expanding locations taking advantage of students .

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Worth, TX
pros: The culture at this campus is one where all employees feel appreciated and valued.  I work with a dynamic team where we support and help each other in our individual and team goals.  In my time here, I have received training that has afforded me the opportunity to grow and advance within the company.  Overall, it is a wonderful company.
cons: I believe there is room for interdepartmental communication  and teamwork.

job_title: Director of Admissions in Austin, TX
pros: CHCP  focus is students first. This message echos from all employees that our student are the focus of our school and business. This quality was very important to me when it came to choosing a "Best Place to Work" .
cons: The cost of insurance is  high for a family.

review_title: Innovative , Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence-ICARE
job_title: Senior Admisssion Advisor in South Houston, TX
pros: The admissions team is hardworking as well as financial aid and management.  The school thrives on servicing students and is committed to producing quality professionals for the communities they live in.  As an employee, we have career advancement opportunities and ongoing support from corporate.  After every shift, I delight in the fact that I have truly made a difference in someones life.
cons: There are no Cons to report

review_title: Love the interaction with the students Training and molding them to become the future health care providers.
pros: It is very rewarding to watch the students grow into great health care professionals.  From newbies to walking the stage. Very rewarding. We all work together as a team to accomplish the goal of student education and career.
cons: Teachers always no matter where have very long hours.  Turn over in Management too often.

pros: I get challenged daily.  I enjoy my coworkers.  Management is consistent with mission statement.  I like seeing the light come on in our students faces when they "get it".
cons: As with any regulated field, lots of paper work.  Forms change often and hard to keep up with.  Very slow internet.

review_title: I enjoyed helping students work towards obtaining their career goals.
pros: Assisting students in goals setting and overcoming obstacles that occur while they are in training.
cons: Hustle working environment among staff members, tons of gossip and unprofessional behavior.  Middle and upper management was great.

pros: Employees work as team within departments. Management takes the time to acknowledge employee ideas. A lot of collaboration with the Health care community. This company will make you feel like you are making a difference each day. From CEO to lower Managmemt great rapport with students and employees.
cons: A few transitional hiccups at times due to growing company.

pros: Team oriented place, allowed to branch out and grow your input is valued at least at the middle management level. I have not had to utilize anything higher yet. I would hope that the training has trickled down from upper management.
cons: Takes a bit of time to see the results that one would like to see, but that comes with the territory of adult education.

job_title: Admissions Director in San Antonio, TX
pros: Pros: Working in Admissions I was able to help inspire and motivate prospective students to get training for a new career.
cons: Cons: Without a doubt it is employee turnover; in almost every position. It seems like they are always trying to make a new start and change direction in leadership. If you consider working here ask how long management has been in place and how many people have been in that position in the past 2-4 years. You will be shocked if you get the correct answer!

pros:
Great Communication
Open Door Policy
Great Student and Faculty Support
Open to New Ideas
On Spot with Compliance Regulations
Campus Events
cons:
Not being able to save a student due to outside factors.
Traffic is bad in this area.
No separation of vacation and sick time, PTO is PTO.
Limited on Space.

review_title: Full time less than a year

pros: I have been with the company less than a year but they have made me feel welcome and appreciated.  The support from the other staff members and Corporate has been great if I have needed anything or whatever questions I might have they are always there to help out.
cons: None to share at this time

pros:

job_title: Senior Director in North Houston, TX
pros: Exciting place to work, enjoy changing lives of prospective students daily.  Campus Management is engaged with day to day operations and with all students.  Atmosphere is energetic and never boring!
cons: None to report at this time.

review_title: Wonderful Team, Great Atmosphere for faculty, staff, and students
pros: Everyone is helpful to one another.  Always greeted with a smile and a hello when walking down any of the hallways.
cons: None.  I even enjoy the long commute as I know I am going to a happy work place!

job_title: Anonymous Employee in North Houston, TX
pros: This school is awesome. I love working here. Everyone is  passionate about all of the students.  It is like a big family. Being in Career Services I am able to change lives daily which makes my job so fulfilling.  THIS IS A GREAT SCHOOL!
cons: No cons at all.

job_title: Director of Financial Aid in Dallas, TX
pros: Culture is pleasant and the company is growing. Management is focused on outcomes and compliance.  Overall CHCP is a good company to work for.
cons: My main con would be the commute as it takes me about 50 minutes to an hour to drive to and from work.

pros: Upper Level support of my job duties; faculty, corporate, and students respect me; flexible work hours; comfortable surroundings; positive work environment.
cons: no salary increase for last two years.

job_title: Senior Financial Aid Administrator in Houston, TX
pros: Room for advancement by initially promoting internally when a position becomes available.   Very motivating and knowledgeable  managment and corporate directors.
cons: None that I can truly think of.

pros: Great environment to work in. Love the students and the staff. Everyone was so friendly and knowledgeable of their jobs and always willing to help others... Great teamwork
cons: I wish the school didn’t have to move locations. I would still be a part of a great company with great people

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Worth, TX
pros:
Meeting new people and families 
The Education Department
cons:
Management, there was so much micromanagement.  Admissions department never cares about the students, they are pressured to make aggressive sales goals. 
Constant turnover, those who are left are incredibly stressed!
Really poor benefits 
I would not recommend anyone to apply at this college, too many cons.  They don’t value their people.

pros: I feel like my manager completely trust in my ability to handle any task without manager input.
cons: We do not always get our expense checks on time.

pros: The educational staff is awesome and the curriculum offers students an opportunity to begin careers in the health care industry
cons: The college could use more space for the high number of students enrolling in the various programs
